benchmark_details.name: Motamot
benchmark_details.overview: The 'Motamot' dataset, comprising 7,058 instances annotated with positive and negative sentiments, is developed specifically for political sentiment analysis in the Bengali language, sourced from diverse online newspapers.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate public sentiments about politics in Bangladeshi online newspapers during elections and provide insights for political parties and voters.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited to positive and negative sentiment labels, potentially restricting granularity in sentiment analysis.

data.source: Compiled from various online newspapers focusing on political events during Bangladeshi elections.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by a team of six student annotators with guidelines ensuring uniformity in sentiment labeling.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance on held-out test sets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 Score indicate better performance in capturing political sentiments.
methodology.validation: Utilized Fleiss Kappa to measure inter-rater reliability, achieving a kappa score of 0.87.
